lines.text: How do you know you're God?
Simple. When I pray to Him, I find I am talking to myself.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: He can't forget being rejected by his mother and father at the age of 11. They sent him away, alone, into a primitive community of licensed bullies and pederasts.
You mean he went to public school.
Exactly.
Behaviour which would be considered insanity in a tradesman is looked upon as mild eccentricity in a lord.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Are you sure you can handle the situation? Marrying a man who thinks he is god?
Happens all the time.
I'm the high-voltage Messiah, the electric Christ, the AC/DC god.
If I had only known then who I was now.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text:
[screams as she sees Jack's giant cross]
Oh! What is it?
A watusi walking stick! Big people, the watusi!
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Naturally, men aren't rats.
Only a man would say so.
I always show respect, sir. That's what I'm paid for.
[blows raspberries]
Join me for a constitutional before lunch, Mr. Tucker.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: [to others]
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Enjoy yourselves while I'm gone. Relax. Have sex.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text:
[shocked]
My... GOD!

[peeping in as if he had been called back]
Yes?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text:
[Awakening in the morning on the giant cross where he sleeps at night]
My heart rises with the sun. I'm purged of doubts and negative innuendos. Today I want to bless everything. Bless the crawfish with it's scuttling walk. Bless the trout, pilchard and periwinkle. Bless Ted Smoothey of 22 East Hackney Road. Bless the mealy redpole, the black-gloved wallaby and W.C. Fields, who is dead but lives on. Bless the snotty-nosed giraffe. Bless the buffalo. Bless the Society of Women Engineers. Bless the pygmy hippy. Bless the mighty cockroach.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: [shouts]
Bless me. Today is my wedding day!
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: [He leaps off the cross]
We're just talking about you and the subject of marriage. We think you should take a wife.
Who from?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: I take your word for it; I put on my glasses because I feel cold.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: It's out of the question!
Who's the head of the Gurney household?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: You are, Jack.
Then don't let me hear you answering unasked questions again!
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: For what I am about to receive, may I make myself truly thankful.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: His lordship is a paranoid schizophrenic.
Paranoid schizophrenic? But he's a Gurney!
Then he's a paranoid schizophrenic Gurney who believes he's God.
But we've always been Church of England!
I was only trying to do what's expected me. I recall as a sign of normalcy in our circle to slaughter anything that moves.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: To love goodness is to love God. To love God is to love the 14th Earl of Gurney.
What about Jack?
the Lord God Almighty Himself.
Are you English?
No.

[slowly]
Ah.
Englishmen like to hear the truth about themselves.
I can't marry a second time.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: You're already married?
August 28, in the year of me, 1964.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Come, doctor, you said he needed a harsh dose of reality. Well, you can't get a harder dose of the stuff than marriage.
My husband's an idiot.
That's not my concern.
A judge can't be unreasonable, so how can he be a lover?
Surely you pray for love and understanding?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Every night...

[glancing pointedly at her husband]
... without success.
Your job's done, Herr Doctor. I'm adjusted. I brush my teeth twice daily and smile.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text:
[to Grace]
I take thee, Marguerite, called Grace Shelley because she doesn't speak French, to be my wedded wife.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text:
[exasperated, after meeting Jack]
Oh, my God!

[ducking back into the room after hearing Charles]
Yes?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: I stand outside myself, watching myself watching myself. I smile, I smile, I smile.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: How dare you bring that woman here!
You should be very grateful to Miss Shelley.
Grace Shelley is your mistress.
Miss Shelley is just a hard working girl.
On her back!

[to Jack]
I didn't travel twenty million miles through galactic space to bandy words with a poxy moon-looney who thinks he's me! Away, or you'll be dropped!
That's very clever, but ah is it true?
Don't come to me for the truth only explanation.
[first lines]
My Lords. Gentlemen. Pray silence for Ralph Douglas Christopher Alexander Gurney, the thirteenth Earl of Gurney.

The aim of the Society of Saint George is to keep Gurney a memory of England. We were once the rulers of the greatest empire the world has ever known. Ruled not by superior force or skill, but by sheer presence.
How did it happen? How did you come to be in this state?

lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: If only I knew then who I am now.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Not here in the garden. Last time I was kissed in a garden it turned out rather awful.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text:
[about competing lunatic]
You're trying to split my mind with his tongue.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Sometimes God turns His back on His people and breaks wind. And the stench clouds the globe!
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: I must learn to keep my mouth shut, bowels open, and never interfere.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Anything you care for? The Grand Canyon? A disused banana factory? Absolution?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: A white wedding.
Would next Tuesday suit you?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: There are certain matters to do with the estate that need clearing up. Nothing important. Just need your signature. Gives me power to handle odd things.
Of course, Uncle.
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: There's no need to read it. Just take my word.
I take your word. I put on my glasses because I feel cold. Where do I sign?
lines.character: Jack Arnold Alexander Tancred Gurney, 14th Earl of Gurney

lines.text: Just there. Excellent, excellent. Easily done, eh?
[reading the signature]
"I, the undersigned, Mycroft Holmes?" Who's Mycroft Holmes?
Brother of Sherlock Holmes, you illiterate oaf.
